abstracts.cdata!:
The Tianhuangping Hydroelectric Project
            Resettlement Plan aims to set out an Action Plan for the
            resettlement and rehabilitation of the Project Affected
            Persons (PAPs) to ensure that they will benefit from the
            project and their standards of living will improve or at
            least be restored after the project impact. To achieve these
            objectives the plan provides for rehabilitation measures so
            that the income earning potential of individuals are
            restored to sustain their livelihoods. Affected productive
            resources of business and public property, infrastructure,
            and cultural property will at least be restored to their
            pre-project levels. The plan covers the production
            restoration plans for the two areas where substations will
            be constructed - Sijing and Hangdong. Land acquisition for
            Sijing Substation will cover 140 mu paddy field owned by
            agricultural collective and will impact Xiaochang Group and
            Zhaojia Group of Xiaochang Administrative Village. Land
            acquisition for Hangdong substation will cover 146.1 mu
            paddy field and will impact the second farm of Xinye Group
            and the Hexing Group of Hongqi Village in Xuxiang Township
            in Haining City. Compensations will take the form of land
            compensation, compensation of standing crops, compensation
            of farming facilities, compensation for endowment,
            conversion of rural residence status into non-rural status,
            or laid off insurance.
